sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: System and communications pro</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline/> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of CMS Sensitive Information as defined in the Risk Management Handbook (RMH), Volume 1, Chapter 10, CMS Risk Management Terms, Definitions, and Acronyms.  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Organizations must:1. Encrypt data at rest in mobile devices for confidentiality to protect against loss, theft, or compromise;2. Encrypt data stored in network share drives to insure confidentiality;3. Encrypt storage/back-up data where physical protection is either not available, not implemented, or not audited;4. If assurance is not provided by other means, encrypt personally identifiable information (PII) in a database; and5. Encrypt data stored in the cloud—whether the cloud is government or private.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="System and Communications Protection">9e873dfcdb211010280df36f29961960</control_family> <control_name>Cryptographic Protection</control_name> <control_number>SC-28(01)</control_number> <control_type>Non-Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>SC-28</group_id> <group_list/> <high>false</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Systems defined as CSPs:  High & Moderate:  CSP.1 - CSPs support the capability to use cryptographic mechanisms to protect information at rest.</implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>false</moderate> <number>ARSC0011185</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:31</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. §552a(b) and (e)(10); FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; OMB Memo: M-06-16, M-17-12 Att. 1, C., 45 C.F.R. §164.312(a)(2)(iv); 45 C.F.R.§164.312(e)(2)(ii)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-13, AC-19, SC-12</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Selection of cryptographic mechanisms is based on the need to protect the confidentiality and integrity of organizational information. The strength of mechanism is commensurate with the security category and/or classification of the information. This control enhancement applies to significant concentrations of digital media in organizational areas designated for media storage and to limited quantities of media generally associated with information system components in operational environments (e.g., portable storage devices, mobile devices). Organizations have the flexibility to either encrypt all information on storage devices (i.e., full disk encryption) or encrypt specific data structures (e.g., files, records, or fields). Organizations employing cryptographic mechanisms to protect information at rest also consider cryptographic key management solutions. For additional Guidance, see: HHS Standard for Encryption of Computing Devices and Information.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Because of the sensitivity of PII and PHI, the confidentiality and integrity of such information must be assured for data at rest using encryption technologies if assurance is not provided by other means.Organizations may use file share scanning (e.g., data loss prevention [DLP] technology) to ensure compliance with the requirement to encrypt PII/protected health information (PHI) at rest.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  Under the HIPAA Security Rule, this is an addressable implementation specification. HIPAA covered entities must conduct an analysis as described at 45 C.F.R. § 164.306 (Security standards: General rules) part (d) (Implementation specifications) to determine how it must be applied within the organization. However, using cryptographic protection allows the organization to utilize the “Safe Harbor” provision under the Breach Notification Rule. If PHI is encrypted pursuant to the Guidance Specifying the Technologies and Methodologies that Render Protected Health Information Unusable, Unreadable, or Indecipherable to Unauthorized.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:31</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>ae873dfcdb211010280df36f299619e0</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:31</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
